chooseSubtree

protected Tree.IndexEntry chooseSubtree(Descriptor descriptor,
                                        java.util.Stack path)
Description copied from class: BPlusTree.Node
Chooses the subtree which is followed during an insertion. In duplicate mode the minIndex is evaluated to positve when with a successful search or negative when the value separator is not found, this negative value points to the position in the list where the new item should be inserted. when this position lies at the end of the list a special case is used to correct the value. In normal mode for negative values of minIndex the item must be inserted before the item at the position pointed at by the returned value. BPlusTree.Node.binarySearch(Comparable)

Overrides:
chooseSubtree in class BPlusTree.Node
Parameters:
descriptor - the Separator of the entry which is to insert
path - the path from the root to this Node. The default implementation does not use this path
Returns:
the IndexEntry pointing to the subtree which is followed during an insertion
See Also:
BPlusTree.Node.chooseSubtree(Descriptor, Stack)

redistributeLeaf

protected boolean redistributeLeaf(java.util.Stack path)
This method always returns false.

See Also:
BPlusTree.Node#redistributeLeaf(Stack)

split

protected Tree.Node.SplitInfo split(java.util.Stack path)
This method is used to split the first Node on the path in two Nodes. The current Node should be the empty new Node. The method distributes the entries of overflowing Node to the both Nodes. The Split-Algorithm (This is equivalent to the R*Tree SplitAlgorithm after the suitable axis was choosen) tests all distributions (M-2m+2) according the SpaceFillingCurve order and chooses distribution with minimal overlap-, margin- and area Value.

Overrides:
split in class BPlusTree.Node
Parameters:
path - the Node already visited during this insert
Returns:
a SplitInfo containig all needed information about the split

                                       java.util.Stack path)
Updates MBR after the entry was deleted but the node was not overflow

Overrides:

redressUnderflow

protected boolean redressUnderflow(BPlusTree.IndexEntry indexEntry,
                                   BPlusTree.Node node,
                                   java.util.Stack path,
                                   boolean up)
Description copied from class: BPlusTree.Node
Treats underflows which occur during a remove operation. It calls the method BPlusTree.Node.merge(BPlusTree.IndexEntry, Stack)to redistribute the elements of the underflowing Node an a suitable sibling or to merge them so that the underflow is repaired.

Overrides:
redressUnderflow in class BPlusTree.Node
Parameters:
indexEntry - the IndexEntry referring to the underflowing Node
node - the underflowing Node
path - the path from the root to parent of the underflowing Node
up - signals whether the treated Nodes have to be updated in the underlying Container
Returns:
a boolean which indicate whether the parent Node was been updated during the operation
See Also:
BPlusTree.Node.redressUnderflow(xxl.core.indexStructures.BPlusTree.IndexEntry, xxl.core.indexStructures.BPlusTree.Node, Stack, boolean)
